DOC.brief_summary: The traditional model of localizing a nerve for blockade is using a peripheral nerve stimulator, PNS. Recent advances in UltraSound technology has allowed UltraSound to guide nerve blockade. However despite excellent visualization nerve block success has not significantly improved. I aim to show that this is because the PNS stimulation of a nerve is more than a proximity response as thought but a correct fascial plane response and hence the high success rate of this blind approach.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound Vs Nerve Stimulation - Why is a PNS so Effective?
DOC.criteria: ASA 1 to 3 patients for any shoulder surgery or unilateral ACL knee surgery Refusal to consent Allergy to Chirocaine local anaesthetic Pace maker in situ Sepsis at site of regional block
